questions.uddipok: Cheek the following graph on the national income per capita of some of the Asian countries. Now, analyze the graph focusing on the main aspects.

sub_questions.explanation:
National per capita income of some of the Asian countries
Here the graph represents the national per capita income of some of the Asian countries in 2010. According to the information in the graph per capita income in Vietnam is US\$1110. In India per capita income, as the graph shows, is US\$1340. Per capita income in Sri Lanka shows itself to be US\$2240. At last comes the information about Bangladesh where per capita income is shown to be US\$700 only. Thus in respect of amount of the per capita income of the above-mentioned countries, Sri Lanka occupies the first position, India second, Vietnam third and Bangladesh last position. It is very sad that the national per capita income of Bangladesh is very low. People of Bangladesh should endeavour (চেষ্টা করা) hard to increase their per capita income. Otherwise, we won't be able to keep pace with the developed countries. of the world and we won't be able to raise our head in the world as a developed country.

questions.uddipok:
Read the opening of the following story and complete it :
Ahmed had completed his graduation from Sunamganj. He has not got a job yet. Some of his friends serve in various offices in Dhaka. So, he left Sunamganj with a great hope in mind that his friends would help him get a job……………………

sub_questions.explanation:
Self-employment is Better Than Unemployment
Ahmed has completed his graduation from Sunamganj. He has not got a job yet. Some of his friends serve in various offices in Dhaka. So, he left Sunamgand with a great hope in mind that his friends would help him get a job for him. One day, he arrived at the flat of his close friend on Dhaka University campus. He also visited other friend'' residences but nobody could help him. He became disappointed (হতাশ) and returned to his own village. Then he got himself admitted into a vocational training center and took training on Mechanical Engineering. He wanted to establish a workshop to repair vehicles. He went to the Grameen Bank, consulted the manager and took a loan of one lakh taka from there. He established a workshop by the highway on their family land. He employed three men as his assistants. With the passage of time, Ahmed became extremely busy. He along with his team, could hardly manage any time to relax from morning till night. He employed another three helpers. His business flourished (উন্নতি লাভ করা) beyond imagination. It went on flourishing day by day. He expanded his workshop to meet up the daily demands. Within three years, he set up a CNG station on the same chunk of land. Ahmed by the time got married. He began to lead a very happy and peaceful life. He got his younger brothers and sisters to be admitted to schools. He was altogether content with his present way of life.

questions.uddipok: Imagine, you have a friend who is a foreign national. He has asked you what you'd show him if he comes to visit you for three days. Write a letter describing your plan.

sub_questions.explanation:
Dhaka, Bangladesh
25 July 2023
Dear Jack,
Take my love. Yesterday I received your letter. In your letter, you have asked me what I would show you if you come to visit me. for three days. I am very pleased to learn that you want to visit me and my country. Actually, immediately after reading the letter and learning of your desire I have made a plan about the places and things in my country I will show you. On the first day, we will visit our capital city Dhaka, where you will see many places of historical importance and interest such as our National Museum, Lalbagh Fort, Ahsan Manzil Museum and Bangladesh National Parliament. The next day, I will take you to Cox's Bazar, the longest sea beach of the world. It is a very attractive beach which attracts millions ' of tourists from home and abroad almost all the year round. The scenes of rising and setting sun of the wide span of water are really charming. Here there are luxurious (বिনাসবহুল) hotels where you will be able to eat various tasty foods including a variety of sea fishes. On the third day, I will take you to Chattogram Hill Tracts which comprise Rangamati, Khagrachhari and Bandarban districts of the country. Here the tribal people and their lifestyle are very interesting. And your eyes will feast upon the beautiful landscape of the hills and mountains of the areas. I think you will greatly enjoy seeing these hilly areas, the tribal people and their culture.
So, my friend, get prepared to visit me and my beautiful country. I am waiting for your letter to be informed of the date of your arrival so that I can receive you at the airport.
No more today. Please convey my best regards to your parents and love to your younger sister Larisa.
Yours ever,
Talha Siddiquee

questions.uddipok:
Summarize the following text.
Many adolescents face pressure to use alcohol, cigarettes, or other drugs and to initiate sexual relationships putting
themselves at high risk for intentional and unintentłonal injuries, unintended pregnancies, and sexually transmitted infections (STIs), including the human immunodeficiency virus (HIV). Many also experience a wide range of adjustment and mental health problems. Behaviour patterns that are established during this period such as the use or avoidance of drugs and taking or abstaining from sexual risk can have long-lasting negative and positive effects on future health and well-being. As a result, adults have unique opportunities to influence adolescents. Adolescents are different both from young children and adults. Specifically, adolescents are not fully capable of understanding complex concepts, or the relationship between behaviour and consequences, or the degree of control they have or can have over health decision-making, including that related to sexual behaviour. This inability may make them particularly vulnerable to sexual exploitation and high-risk behaviours. Laws, customs, and practices may also affect adolescents differently than adults. For example, laws and policies often restrict adolescents' access to reproductive health information and services, especially when they are unmarried. In addition, even when services do exist, provider attitudes about adolescents often pose a significant barrier to the use of those services.

sub_questions.explanation: This passage highlights on the critical moments of adolescents, and the complexity and pressures they face during adolescence period. This phase is so critical since he/she has to face difficulties to adjust with them. They face life-destructing pressures and a wide range of mental and health problems. Also, this period is the shaper of his/her future with negative or positive effects. Adolescents are unable to perceive the complex concepts of life. Therefore, they become very vulnerable to high-risk behaviours and sexual exploitation. There are some restrictions and laws imposed on them to control or prevent them from going astray. As this phase is so critical for them, adults and other concerned authorities should be aware to guide them in the right direction.

Read the following text and make a flow chart highlighting the different aspects of sociocultural life as reflected in folk music.
In Bangladesh, folk music has great variety, with songs composed on culture, festivals, views of life, natural beauty, rivers and rural and riverine life. These songs are also about social inequality and poverty, about the material world and the supernatural. Mystical songs have been composed using the metaphors of rivers and boats. Since the country is basically riverine, the Bhatiyali forms an important genre of folk music. Nature plays a role in providing the content and rhythm of folk music. The folk music of Bangladesh varies from region to region, reflecting changes in the natural environment and the dialects people use.
